name: neighbor
title: Spotting a neighbor
statement1: As you are walking down a crowded street, you see your neighbor on the other side. You call out, but they do not answer you. Standing there in the street, you think that this must be because they were distracted.
question: Did your neighbor purposely ignore your call to them in the street?
ifthen: If I reach out to someone and they don't respond, then I will remind myself they are probably not ignoring me on purpose.

name: dentist
title: Checks at the dentist
statement1: You have a routine dentist appointment and find out that you need some tests to check the health of your gums and teeth. After the dentist performs the tests, you continue to lie in the dentist chair while waiting for the results. You think your teeth and gums are probably healthy.
question: Do you think you have gum disease?
ifthen: If I'm waiting to hear news from a doctor, then I will remind myself that I can handle what they tell me.

name: chair
title: A squeaky chair
statement1: You arrive to a morning meeting exactly on time, but you are the last one to arrive. Your coworkers look at you as you pull out your chair, and it squeaks loudly. They all turn to look at you with a slight frown.
statement2: In the end, you realize that your coworkers are just good employees who were enthusiastic to get the meeting started. They responded to you during the rest of the meeting quite positively.
question: Do your coworkers judge you negatively?
ifthen: If I think my coworkers are annoyed with me, I will remind myself that it will probably pass soon.

name: language
title: Language course exam
statement1: As part of a language course, you are required to take an oral exam. The material has been briefly covered in class, and you were asked to do some individual research. During class, as you wait your turn, you feel that others will think you seem smart.
question: Will others think you seem intelligent when presenting?
ifthen: If I am being evaluated, then I will remember that people probably think I'm doing a great job.

name: aid
title: First aid course
statement1: You have completed a first aid course and now have to take a practical test, in which you demonstrate what you learned in front of your classmates. You spent the evening before practicing for the difficult test. As you begin the test, your classmates observing you think you are unprepared.
question: Do your classmates think you are prepared for the practical test?
ifthen: If I am worried about speaking in a group, then I will remind myself that I don't know what people are thinking about me.

name: section
title: Turning in a paper
statement1: You are taking a class and recently turned in a paper. You decide to re-read your submitted paper, and realize that you accidentally deleted a section you meant to include in the paper. Given that you accidentally made this deletion, you think that you are likely to pass.
question: Are you going to get a passing grade on the paper?
ifthen: If I ______, then I will ________.

name: shaky
title: Interview anticipation
statement1: You are being interviewed for a really great job. Before you walk into the room, you notice you feel shaky. You feel incredibly excited.
question: Does feeling shaky frighten you?
ifthen: If I am nervous before an interview, then I will focus on taking deep breaths.

name: horseback
title: Weekend horseback riding
statement1: You are going horseback riding on the weekend. When you get there, the riding instructor gives you a large horse to ride. Soon the horse starts to gallop quickly, and you feel excited.
question: Is it fun to try riding the horse?
ifthen: If something unexpected happens while I'm trying a new activity, then I will remind myself that feeling surprised is normal.

name: report
title: Writing a report
statement1: Your supervisor asks you to write a report. The finished document is quite brief but took a lot of time and effort. Based on your writing, you expect your supervisor's opinion of you will be positive.
question: Do you expect your supervisor to have a positive opinion of you after reading your report?
ifthen: If my work is being evaluated, then I will remind myself that I did my best.

name: bus
title: Bus stop rush
statement1: It's Monday morning and you are hurrying to the bus stop to catch your bus. You feel your heart racing as you step onto the bus and sit down. Fearing that you might have a panic attack, you have a strong urge to get off the bus, and yet you decide to observe these sensations without reacting and stay seated.
question: Is it necessary to get off the bus because you feel your heart beating rapidly?
ifthen: If I am feeling sudden physical sensations, then I will remind myself that these feelings are probably temporary.

name: haircut
title: A different haircut
statement1: While at the hairdresser's, you opt for a completely different haircut. When you see your friend afterwards, they gasp. Their gasps probably means that they think the new style makes you look great.
question: Does your friend like your new haircut?
ifthen: If a friend reacts to how I look, then I will remind myself that they might be pleasently surprised.

name: audition
title: Auditioning for a play
statement1: You are about to audition for a play. You feel your body tremble. Other people are nearby, which is worrying.
question: Are you glad that other people are nearby when you feel shaky?
ifthen: If I get nervous before a performance, then I will remember that I can tolerate the nervousness.

name: outfit
title: Thoughts on your outfit
statement1: You arrive at a party in a new outfit. Everyone turns to look at you as you walk in. You decide that they must think that you look stylish.
question: Did everyone at the party like your new outfit?
ifthen: If people look at me when I walk in a room, then I will remind myself that they are probably not judging me.

name: radio
title: Driving with the radio on
statement1: You are in the car with your mother-in-law and you put on the radio. As you discuss which station to listen to, you realize that you and your mother-in-law have musical tastes that are wildly clashing.
statement2: After having a discussion about the pros and cons of different music styles, you realize that she probably does not mind that your tastes clash and simply sees you as knowledgeable.
question: Does your mother-in-law think you know nothing about music?
ifthen: If I disagree with someone, then I will remind myself that it is okay to have different opinions.

name: ocean
title: An international flight
statement1: You are going on a trip to another country. During the flight, you look out the window and realize you've never been so far above the ocean. You feel thrilled.
question: Is it exhilarating to be so high up?
ifthen: If I am anxious about being high off the ground, then I will remind myself that feeling anxious doesn’t mean I am in danger.

name: sick
title: Appointment with the doctor
statement1: You have been feeling a little sick lately, so you schedule a doctor's appointment. The soonest appointment you can get is a few days away. While you wait for your doctor's appointment, you think your sickness is probably temporary.
question: Do you think you are going to feel better soon?
ifthen: If I have to wait before getting an answer to a question I'm worried about, then I will remind myself that I can tolerate the anxiety I feel.

name: creative
title: Creative writing class
statement1: A friend suggests that you join an evening class on creative writing. You go online and read information about the class. As you navigate through the site, the thought of other people looking at your writing makes you feel enthusiastic.
question: Do you expect to feel uncomfortable if others look at your work?
ifthen: If people are reviewing my work, then I will remind myself that getting feedback is usually helpful.

name: coworkers
title: Attending a dinner
statement1: Your partner asks you to go to a dinner with their coworkers. You have not met these people before and wonder what they will think of you. Getting ready to go, you think that the new people will will find you interesting.
question: Will you be disliked by your new acquaintances?
ifthen: If I ______, then I will ________.

name: apartment
title: Shopping for a party
statement1: You are co-hosting a dinner party at your friend's apartment, and you just finished all the shopping. You start to sweat and feel your heart pounding after a couple of trips carrying the groceries up to the third floor. You feel a bit scared of these sensations. Unsure of whether they are good or bad, you decide to simply accept them.
question: Could you accept your racing heart as neither good nor bad?
ifthen: If I am feeling sudden physical sensations, then I will remind myself that these feelings are probably temporary.

name: degree
title: Returning to school
statement1: You have decided to go back to school for another degree. Although you have been saving for this for the past few years, you worry about not having an income while you are back in school. The likelihood that you will go broke while in school is minimal.
question: Will you become broke once you go back to school?
ifthen: If I am worried about fianances, then I will remind myself that I am financially responsible.

name: movie
title: Flashing movie
statement1: You are watching a movie in a theater. There are many sweeping camera shots that make you feel dizzy. This sensation is funny.
question: Does it alarm you when you feel dizzy?
ifthen: If I start to feel dizzy, then I will remind myself that this feeling is only temporary.

name: department
title: Departmental talk
statement1: You have to give a talk to another department for work. As you think about the talk, you feel butterflies in your stomach. On the morning of the talk, you feel nervous, and you think your nerves will be manageable.
question: Are you able to tolerate your anxiety?
ifthen: If I feel nervous before giving a presentation, then I will remind myself that stress helps people perform well.

name: night
title: Night awaking
statement1: It's the middle of the night and you wake up abruptly. As you sit up, you feel weird, like your mind isn't working right, and you start to think you might be going crazy. This thought frightens you, and you decide as you lay back down that you will just observe it.
question: Do you need to fight your strange feelings in order to make your anxiety go away?
ifthen: If I have a scary thought, then I remind myself that all thoughts eventually pass.

name: babysitting
title: Careful babysitting
statement1: You are babysitting, and the child is outside playing with friends. You look out the window to check on them, and they are not there. The child is probably fine.
question: Is the child okay?
ifthen: If I am in an uncertain situation, then I will remind myself not to jump to conclusions.

name: interns
title: New summer interns
statement1: Your boss has hired a few interns for the summer. Your boss asks you to stay after work to give them a brief presentation about the company's goals and values but tells you that this is completely optional. You feel a little nervous about giving the presentation, and you decide to stay.
question: Do you stay to give the optional presentation?
ifthen: If I am giving a presentation, then I will remind myself that it is good opportunity to practice public speaking.

name: guests
title: Dinner party invitation
statement1: A friend invites you to a dinner party that they are holding. They tell you who the other guests are, but you do not recognize any of the other names. You go anyway, and on the way there, you think that the other guests will find you friendly.
question: Will you be well liked at the party?
ifthen: If I'm meeting new people, then I will remind myself that I can make a good impression.

name: sign
title: Late friends
statement1: You arrive at a party and notice that your friends haven't arrived yet. No one talks to you initially, and after 30 minutes pass there is still no sign of your friends. As you finish eating some food in the kitchen, you feel self-conscious and decide to leave.
statement2: As you head to the door to slip out, you realize that the people at the party probably feel a little reserved too. You return to the kitchen and start a conversation with two people you do not know. They are friendly, and you are glad that you chose to stay.
question: Are you glad that you decided to stay at the party?
ifthen: If I am with a large group of new people, then I will remember that they may feel nervous like me.

name: mole
title: A mole on your arm
statement1: You notice a mole on your arm that you haven't noticed before. You schedule a doctor's appointment to have it examined. As you wait for your appointment, you think the mole is concerning.
question: Is the new mole a sign of cancer?
ifthen: If I'm waiting to hear news from a doctor, then I will remind myself that I will can handle what they tell me.

name: photo
title: Social media photo
statement1: You are invited to a party and decide to wear a new outfit that is not your typical style. The next day you see that your photograph has been posted on a social media website. The thought of everyone seeing your photo makes you feel embarrassed.
statement2: In the end, you realize that many people feel embarrassed when seeing their own picture in public. Other people will probably enjoy seeing your photo on the social media website.
question: Are you looking forward to others seeing your picture on the website?
ifthen: If I ______, then I will ________.

name: grandmother
title: Calling your grandmother
statement1: Every Monday you call your grandmother to say hello. Today is Monday, and she did not pick up the phone when you called, which is unusual. Your grandmother probably did not answer the phone because she is busy.
question: Is your grandmother unable to talk because she is ill?
ifthen: If I am in an uncertain situation, then I will remind myself not to jump to conclusions.

name: deadline
title: Tasked in a new job
statement1: You are new to a job, and your boss asks you to do a task. You finish it before the deadline and your boss immediately points out that you made a mistake. Your boss probably thinks you are a failure.
statement2: In the end, you realize that your boss is prompt in giving you feedback because they are investing in you, and interested in seeing you progress.
question: Does your boss believe that your work holds promise?
ifthen: If my boss gives me feedback, then I will remind myself that she values me enough to want to help me improve.

name: boss
title: Meeting with your boss
statement1: You have a one-on-one meeting today with your intimidating boss, which you are nervous about. During the meeting, you momentarily lose your train of thought. After that, your anxiety is tolerable.
question: Are you able to tolerate your anxiety while meeting with your boss?
ifthen: If I lose my train of thought while speaking, then I will remind myself that it is normal, and I will keep going.

name: throat
title: A scratchy throat
statement1: Getting up this morning, you notice that your throat is scratchier than it usually is. You think about why this may be. You decide it is probably because you are thirsty.
question: Will drinking some water make your throat feel better?
ifthen: If I notice changes in my body, then I will remember that they might not be related to my health.

name: paint
title: Tingled fingers
statement1: You are helping a friend paint a house and have been raising your hand for a long time. Your fingers begin to tingle. This sensation is funny.
question: Do the tingling feelings in your fingers make you nervous?
ifthen: If I notice changes in my body, then I will remember that they might not be related to my health.

name: economy
title: News on the economy
statement1: You recently saw on the news that the economy has been particularly bad. Even though your boss typically gives you good reviews, you wonder whether your job is safe. You think you will likely be fine.
question: Is it likely that you will be fired?
ifthen: If I am worried about keeping my job, then I will remind myself that I'm doing my best.

name: typo
title: Submitting a paper
statement1: You are going to turn in a paper. As you walk, you glance down and realize there is a small typo on the last page of your paper. You believe that you should be concerned.
question: Should you be troubled about the small typo?
ifthen: If I make a small mistake in my work, then I  will emind myself that it does not reflect failure.

name: evaluation
title: First work evaluation
statement1: The morning of your first evaluation with your new boss has arrived. They tell you that they have strong views about your work. You think that they likely find your work excellent.
question: Do you think your new boss has an unfavorable opinion of your work?
ifthen: If my boss wants to discuss my work, then I will remind myself that getting feedback is helpful.

name: lecture
title: Spacing out
statement1: You are in class listening to a lecture. You stop paying attention and space out for a minute or two. When you begin to pay attention again, you are relaxed.
question: Do you feel calm after you space out during a lecture?
ifthen: If I start to space out, then I will remind myself to focus on what is happening in front of me.

name: topic
title: Interesting evening class
statement1: You consider taking an evening class in which part of your grade is based on your participation, even though you do not like speaking up in front of others. Because the topic is really interesting, you decide to sign up for the class. After signing up, you realize that this decision was great.
question: Are you happy that you signed up for the interesting evening class?
ifthen: If I need to speak in public, then I will remind myself that it is a good opportunity to challenge myself.

name: colleagues
title: Overhearing your name
statement1: At work you overhear some colleagues discussing other people and hear your name mentioned. You do not hear everything they say, but when you walk by, they suddenly look away with guilt.
statement2: Afterwards, you realize that many people engage in office gossip from time to time and that your colleagues probably did not mean to make you feel bad. In fact, it is possible that they were saying something positive.
question: Were your colleagues saying negative things about you?
ifthen: If I hear people say my name, then I will remind myself that they might be talking about someone else.
